lines.content: Duke is a chatbot which functions as a to-do-list. It has fairly simple commands and can be used to keep track of your schedules!
We will keep uploading the chatbot with new additional features, so look forward to it!
- The chatbot provides a list for the user to interact and create the to-do list with.
- The command line to view the list is 'list'.
### Feature-2 : Add, set status, and remove tasks from list
- The chatbot provides commands for users to add tasks, delete tasks, and set task status to finished from the list.
- There are 3 types of tasks you can add :
A general task need to be finished with no time limit.
A task that needs to be finished before a specific time.
A task that happens between a certain time period.
Used to exit the chatbot. The bot will send a goodbye message before exiting.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Used to add one of the tasks with the type deadline to the list. You can see the deadline tag marked with [D] in the to-do list.
The command takes in two parameters : a string which indicates the deadline task name, and a string which indicates the deadline, separated with a backslash ("/")
Here are the tasks on your list:
The list will add the deadline below the newest task, and the deadline task will have 2 as its index number in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 task(s) in the list.
Used to remove one of the tasks on the to-do list from the chatbot. You need to specify the index number of the tasks you want to remove (you can refer to it from the list!)
The command takes in one parameter : an integer indicating the index number from the list of the task you want to remove from the list.
Here are the tasks on your list:
It will remove the task from the list.
Now you have 0 task(s) on the list.
### `done` - mark the task status as done
Used to mark one of the tasks on the to-do list as done from the chatbot. You need to specify the index number of the tasks you want to mark (you can refer to it from the list!)
The command takes in one parameter : an integer indicating the index number from the list of the task you want to mark as done.
Here are the tasks on your list:
It will mark the task in the list as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Used to add one of the tasks with the type event to the list. You can see the event tag marked with [E] in the to-do list.
The command takes in two parameters : a string which indicates the event name, and a string which indicates the event timeline, separated with a backslash ("/")
Here are the tasks on your list:
The list will add the event below the newest task, and the event will have 2 as its index number in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 task(s) in the list.
Used to view the to-do list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 task(s) in the list.
Here are the tasks on your list:
Used to add one of the tasks with the type todo to the list. You can see the todo tag marked with [T] in the to-do list.
The command takes in a parameter : a string which indicates the task name.
Here are the tasks on your list:
The list will add the todo task below the newest task, and the task will have 2 as its index number in the list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 task(s) in the list.
